etymologies: from Italian intarsio; in intarsia (sense 2) superseding earlier tarsia (from Italian, ‘marquetry’); the knitting term dates from the mid 19th century

definitions: a method of knitting with a number of colors, in which a separate length or ball of yarn is used for each area of color (as opposed to different yarns being carried at the back of the work)
shortDefinitions: method of knitting with several colours, in which separate length or ball of yarn is used for each area of colour

definitions: an elaborate form of marquetry using inlays in wood, especially as practiced in 15th-century Italy.
shortDefinitions: elaborate form of marquetry using inlays in wood

definitions: similar inlaid work in stone, metal, or glass.
shortDefinitions: similar inlaid work in stone or glass
